column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=What could cause some dynamics is that you need money for all these packages , and you can only really get that through strong reduction targets .
#Text=Be it Climate charges or taxes , auctioning of emission certificates , or a sort of Tobin tax on international emissions trading .
#Text=That leads to those nations that want money out of the packages having an incentive to work for stronger reduction targets .
#Text=It is to be hoped for that movement for strong emission targets as well as for the financing of technologies , forest protection and adaptation measures develops .

#Text=And that a coalition of progressive industrial nations , least developed countries ( the so called LDCs ) and newly industrialized countries - for example China , Mexico , South Africa , India - support this .
#Text=There were first signs for such a development in Bali .
#Text=Outlook on the next two years
#Text=How do things continue after this conference ?
#Text=What 's the course of events until the Conference in Copenhagen , Denmark 2009 ?
#Text=The four packages

#Text=climate protection targets , adaptation to climate change , accelerated commercial launching of the necessary technologies and financing of technology , forest protection and adaptation have to be negotiated in detail now .
#Text=Next year there will be four rounds of negotiations .
#Text=The final conclusion is to be reached by the end of 2009 , at the climate summit in Copenhagen .
#Text=What needs to happen in this period of time in your opinion ?
#Text=What do the agreements that are hopefully to be reached need to look like ?
#Text=The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions , so that a warming of more than 2°C ( 35.6 F ) is averted , is central .
#Text=The global average temperatures must n't rise above 2°C in comparison with pre-industrial levels .
#Text=We call this the aversion of the uncopeable , as the risks of such a warming would be simply too great .
#Text=To achieve this goal a reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by 50-85 % by 2050 is necessary .
#Text=For the middle term this means that the peak of global emissions needs to be reached in 10-15 years and that the output is cut considerably year after year from then onwards .
#Text=The group of industrialized nations have to reduce their emissions by 25-40 % till 2020 ( compared to 1990 baselines ) on average to make this possible .
#Text=Regarding adaptation , what we call coping with the inadvertable , the scale of funding is going to have to change .
#Text=Roughly US$ 50 billion a year are going to be required .
#Text=We should n't think that the problem is just in the U.S. , even if it is to be seen most clearly there .
#Text=Many of us [ Germans/Europeans ] do n't realize what the necessary emission cuts mean .
#Text=— Christoph Bals
#Text=What do you see as ( the biggest ) obstacle(s) on the way to such an agreement ?
#Text=You 've already mentioned the current U.S. administration .
